resources.string: This app is a collection of logic puzzles created as a class assignment to demonstrate the ability to use Android Features.

There are many tellings of this puzzle; but in this case the situation is as follows: A Farmer is traveling with a Chicken, a Fox, and a sack of Grain. They come across a \'totally safe\' bridge in their path and do not have time to find another way around it. The bridge is pretty rundown; and the Farmer fears crossing it with all their items. With no other options, the Farmer decides that they are willing to risk crossing the bridge with one item at a time; however, this leaves the Farmer in a predicament. If they leave the Chicken alone with the Grain, the Chicken will eat it! Likewise, if they leave the Fox alone with the Chicken, the Fox will eat the Chicken! How can the Farmer safely cross the bridge without losing the Grain or the Chicken?
Tap the ? on the toolbar to view this page.
Swipe from the right during a puzzle to open the hints screen.
The hints screen offers a summary of the rules, a generic hint, and an optional direct hint.
You can only cross with one item at a time. If left alone, the fox will eat the chicken; and the chicken will eat the grain.
You are able to cross the bridge without taking anything with you.
The bridge looks too dangerous to cross with multiple items.
If you leave the Fox alone with the Chicken, the Fox will eat the Chicken!
If you leave the Chicken alone with the Grain, the chicken will eat it!
If you leave everything unattended, the Chicken will eat the Grain, and the Fox will eat the Chicken!
